markdownRemark.html:
Time management crisis hits everyone. You are not alone in this.

If you are struggling to find the time for the fellowship, then you are not alone. In this session, I will share how to manage priorities by deciding what not to do and being productive. I will also share an effective time management strategy that you can apply to manage your time effectively during the fellowship.

---tweet

“If you are dealing with a time management crisis, then you are not alone.”

Recently, I spoke to the @MLHacks fellows on how to manage priorities by deciding what not to do and being productive.

It’s quite easy to get overwhelmed with no. of things to do while managing an internship + college work. One common mistake is failing to communicate availability and set expectations.

Eg: When you have exams let your mentors and peers know that you will be unavailable during this time well in advance; unless it is a last-minute exam for which you would have had to allocate few hours of preparation every day; both of which require prior communication. I like the Eisenhowwer method to identify things which are important, urgent and identify which ones to eliminate or delegaete. Eg: there is a time critical deadline at college or work, this one is urgent in terms of achieving. But in terms of your participatinon it may not be important and you can easil delegete to someone. asd too and urgent and k
